Thanks Gordon. I do remember this now that you mentioned it. What started all this was my trying to "date" the gold dai-sho menuki I mentioned. When I see "gold" I tend to think "late Edo" but that's not always true. The set I bought from Fred, being a dai-sho and of gold still makes me think late Edo; if a single set (not made as a dai-sho) then I probably should be thinking "maybe earlier." Oh such fun with these toys, eh? 

Ron

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: ROBSON Gordon 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, February 27, 2008 3:23 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Kyo-kinko


  Hi Ron,

  My understanding is that Kyo-Kinko is the new name for Waki-Goto. This would 
  make them a grab bag like Ko-Kinko or even Shoami. Their dates are post-Ko-
  Kinko, so early Edo to Bakumatsu. There is a Kyo-Kinko book out there. I think the 
  title is Kyo-Kinko no Kenkyu (research into Kyo-Kinko) or something like that. Jim 
  is probably better up on this stuff then I am.

  On on different note, good luck to Harry. Honto ni gambatte kudasai!!

  Gordon
